parse.title: Choice School for the Gifted and Exceptional

text.*:
This article relies too much on references to primary sources. Please improve this by adding secondary or tertiary sources. (April 2017) (Learn how and when to remove this template message)
Choice School for the Gifted and Exceptional
The Choice School logo
Address
20451 Westminster Hwy
Richmond, British Columbia, V6V 3A2
Canada
Coordinates 49°10′13″N 122°59′42″W﻿ / ﻿49.1704°N 122.9949°W﻿ / 49.1704; -122.9949
Information
Opened 1985
Principal Lynn Chartres
Grades pre K-9
Language English
Website choiceschool.org

The Choice School for the Gifted and Exceptional is an independent special needs school in Richmond, British Columbia[1] with a curriculum designed for gifted and twice exceptional children. The school, while adhering to the British Columbia curriculum, offers a flexible learning environment derived from research based, current best practices for gifted education.[2]

Contents

  • 1 History
  • 2 Elementary
  • 3 Middle School
  • 4 References
  • 5 External links

History[edit]

Originally established in 1985,[3] the school has maintained a focus on gifted education.

In 2016, the British Columbia Ministry of Education included Choice School in its list of "designated special education schools".[4] Placement on this list grants the school access to Ministry of Education funding for extra student support.

Elementary[edit]

In addition to the British Columbia core curriculum, students take part in enriched science, art, and music activities. The school also places a strong emphasis on regular physical activity. All students work with an Individual Education Plan, highlighting the students strengths and areas for further growth.[5] Choice School currently offers pre-kindergarten to grade 8 classes. Class sizes are small and although students are typically grouped with their chronological peers, they can be advanced in accordance with their strengths.[6]

Middle School[edit]

In 2016, Choice School announced that it will begin offering a middle school program in the fall of 2017. This program will focus on supporting grades 7 through 9[7] and will be run separately from the elementary program that will support students from pre-kindergarten to grade 6.

  4. ^ Education, Ministry of. "Special Education Programs and Funding - Independent Schools - Province of British Columbia". www2.gov.bc.ca. Retrieved 2017-04-25.

  6. ^ "Learning at Choice - Choice School for Gifted Children, Richmond, BC". Choice School. Retrieved 2017-04-25.
